FRS_Method: GPS CARRIER PHASE STATIC RELATIVE POSITION

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Skyland Grain, LLC is an agricultural retail business that specializes in grain storage for the area producers as well as providing the necessary inputs for grain production. The Skyland Grain, LLC strives to maintain a safe and healthy work place. Our owners, managers, and employees have made every effort to plan the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia.

The worst case and the alternate release scenarios have been evaluated and shared with our local first responders as part of an ongoing training program. More importantly, our employees have been trained in their respective emergency actions, including the emergency meeting place and each of their individual responsibilities regarding an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia.

The Skyland Grain, LLC maintains and operates their Big Bow-South Anhydrous Ammonia Plant in strict accordance with all state and local authorities. The Kansas Department of Agriculture inspects our plant on a regular basis and we comply with their request for improvement. Changes or improvements ins the facility's equipment will be acted upon immediately following the enforcement agency (KDA's) request, or as found to be necessary by our staff. 

Our employees are trained in safety procedures, site specific operating procedures, plant maintenance and employees are competency tested over the training material. Each employees uses ammonia proof goggles and gloves during ammonia operations as well as always providing plenty of emergency safety water during nurse tanks and maintenance operations. 

Our emergency action plan is designed to minimize the risks to employees, the surrounding public, and the area first responders. The Skyland Grain, LLC provides plant tours for our local fire department and our action plan has been shared with the Stanton County Local Emergency Planning Commission (LEPC). Each of our responding agencies are aware of the dangerous nature of anhydrous ammonia and they have agreed to assist us
in the event of an emergency or accidental release.
